body: InfluxDB fails, please recheck.
Please add version requirement in the latest etcd related docs. As we change in this version, let's be clear.

If there is a plugin bug, which could cache the TID in a reusable thread forever, then you could face this. You need to check which plugin could cause this, and why the last request's context doesn't get cleared properly.

> The boundary between `custom-trace-sample-rate` and existing `sampleRate` is not clear. If you want to do service based sample rate setting, the first step should make it supported in static configuration. Sample rate is a static configuration in the `application.yml`, you should make it separate in another `trace-sample-rate-setting.yml`, then, make the dynamic configuration works. Also, this should not be a different configuration than existing logic, otherwise, the users would be very confused, which sample rate would take effect if they set both.

Like that configure sampling rate by the same configuration in the `application.yml`?
```
agent-analyzer:
  selector: ${SW_AGENT_ANALYZER:default}
  default:
    #sampleRate: ${SW_TRACE_SAMPLE_RATE:10000} # The config had moved to 'traceSampleRateSettingFile' and had been replaced by 'global.sampleRate' that the config in 'traceSampleRateSettingFile'.
    #slowTraceSegmentThreshold: ${SW_SLOW_TRACE_SEGMENT_THRESHOLD:-1} # The config had moved to 'traceSampleRateSettingFile' and had been replaced by 'global.duration' that the config in 'traceSampleRateSettingFile'.
    traceSampleRateSettingFile: ${SW_TRACE_SAMPLE_RATE_SETTING_FILE:trace-sample-rate-setting.yml}
```

And `trace-sample-rate-setting.yml`:

```
global:
  sampleRate: 10000 # the replace the old config `sampleRate` in  the application.yml.
  duration: 10000 # the replace the old config `slowTraceSegmentThreshold` in  the application.yml
services:
  - name: serverName # the server name which show skywalking-ui
    sampleRate: 1000 # endpoint latitude. It has a higher priority than `global.sampleRate`
    duration: 10000 # trace latency time.  It has a higher priority than `global.duration`
```

> Like that configure sampling rate by the same configuration in the `application.yml`?

Yes, something like that. `global` should be renamed as `default`.

> # the server name which show skywalking-ui

Notice, this is not a correct comment for the service name. Service has been defined clearly in the document, you don't need to mention it here.

@wu-sheng ,What is the reason the match has not been successful? Is it because `ExampleJobHandler ` is a local class which in `zeebe-client-scenario`?
In the process of matching between the class and its interceptor, there hasn't even been a situation where 
`typeDescription`  = "org.apache.skywalking.apm.testcase.zeebe.client.job.FirstJobHandler"?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55177318/124431142-963db900-dda2-11eb-9f50-e9063f14c23e.png)

First of all, this was Istio's legacy adaptor, which could and is planned to be removed for a long time.
Second, this is not for tracing, this is for metrics, topology, etc.

The highest value of service mesh observability is that don't need to install an agent, which doesn't include tracing. If you need tracing, Envoy and latest(1.11) have SkyWalking tracer out of box, but still you have to install agent or propagate the `sw8` header in your app by yourself.
For now, if you want observability but not tracing, check our ALS solution(Envoy access log service solution), which is much better than the old and old performance Istio v1 adaptor solution.

I think you missed the key notice in the plugin dev doc, `org.apache.skywalking.apm` should not be used, if you want to instrument it. This package is reserved and used by SkyWalking official classes/APIs only. We don't instrument ourselves.
`test.apache.skywalking` is recommended instead, if I remember correctly. Please check the doc.

We may consider optimizing `service name` and `instance name` in https://github.com/apache/skywalking-data-collect-protocol/blob/master/language-agent/Tracing.proto#L36 service. Only the first segment carries this.

In this case, we have to package the whole streaming as a list, into the event, then #7247 to make sure every batch would be delivered into a specific backend.

Or we could support event id to identify the streaming batch and make sure it could be shipped to the same backend consistently.

> > The boundary between `custom-trace-sample-rate` and existing `sampleRate` is not clear. If you want to do service based sample rate setting, the first step should make it supported in static configuration. Sample rate is a static configuration in the `application.yml`, you should make it separate in another `trace-sample-rate-setting.yml`, then, make the dynamic configuration works. Also, this should not be a different configuration than existing logic, otherwise, the users would be very confused, which sample rate would take effect if they set both.

> > @leizhiyuan As far as I know, dameng8 is a commercial and close-source database, correct?
> 
> It's correct, dameng8 is a commercial and close-source. But dameng8's jdbc driver can be downloaded from it's official website [https://eco.dameng.com/docs/zh-cn/start/java-development.html](url). So we can enhance the driver including specific class.

Then it can't be hosted in the Apache, it is commercial, so no maven central address. They don't set up the license for their driver, so we can't determine our instrumentation codes are valid or not. Decompiling is a tricky way, you could do it, but SkyWalking and Apache Software Foundation don't want to take any risk about violating their IP, commercial license, or branding.

If you want to open the implementation of a plugin for their driver, you could open it on your own repo. We are welcome you to post a blog on https://skywalking.apache.org/zh/ to talk about how to use it.
